official-title.#text:
Expressing support for the designation of
		  September 2013 as

term.#text:
National Sepsis and Septic Shock Awareness
		  Month

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

term.#text:
National Sepsis and Septic Shock Awareness
			 Month

text.#text:
Whereas sepsis is a medical condition that occurs due to
			 an immune response to infection;

Whereas sepsis is a serious medical condition and a
			 leading cause of death;

Whereas about 750,000 people in the United States are
			 infected by sepsis annually;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Institute of General Medical Sciences
			 at the National Institutes of Health
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

text.#text:
Whereas it is estimated that approximately $17,000,000,000
			 annually is spent combating sepsis in the United States;

Whereas the number of sepsis related deaths is currently
			 on the rise in the United States;

Whereas many symptoms of sepsis mimic other conditions,
			 making sepsis difficult to diagnose; and

term.#tail:
to
			 raise awareness and encourage the education of patients, families, and health
			 care professionals on the seriousness of early detection as the key to
			 survival: Now, therefore, be it
term.#text: National Sepsis and Septic Shock Awareness Month

text.#text:
Whereas September 2013 would be an appropriate month to
			 designate as

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 342 IH: Expressing support for the designation of September 2013 as National Sepsis and Septic Shock Awareness Month.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
